citeinfo.title: X-ray Fluorescence Geochemistry of Columbia River Basalt Group Rocks in the Western Columbia River Gorge

descript.abstract: This table contains geochemical data collected for whole-rock samples from the Columbia River Basalt Group in the western Columbia River Gorge in Oregon and Washington. Most samples were collected by Russell C. Evarts and Richard M. Conrey from 2002 to 2014. Samples were collected during traverses along roads, streams, ridgecrests, and other areas as part of ongoing geologic mapping. Additional samples were provided by Marvin H. Beeson. Major- and trace-element analyses were performed by X-ray fluorescence at the Peter Hooper GeoAnalytical Laboratory at Washington State University in Pullman, Washington. No normalization has been applied to these data.
descript.purpose: Data were obtained in support of studies of the Columbia River Basalt Group stratigraphy in the western Columbia River Gorge.

place.placekey: Columbia River Gorge National Scenic Area

attracc.attraccr: No formal accuracy assessment has been performed.

dataqual.logic: No formal assessment of logical consistency has been performed. Some samples have multiple analyses.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: Estimated accuracy of horizontal location is given on a per-feature basis by attribute LocationConfidenceMeters. Values are expected to be correct within a factor of 2. A LocationConfidenceMeters value of -9 indicates that no value has been assigned.

vertacc.vertaccr: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted.

citeinfo.title: XRF Analysis of Rocks and Minerals for Major and Trace Elements on a Single Low Dilution Li-tetraborate Fused Bead

srcinfo.srccontr: Described methods used for X-ray fluorescence in the process step.

citeinfo.title: Geologic map of the Washougal quadrangle, Clark County, Washington, and Multnomah County

srcinfo.srccontr: Provided geochemical data for the study area.

citeinfo.title: Geologic map of the Beacon Rock quadrangle, Skamania County, Washington

srcinfo.srccontr: Provided geochemical data for the study area.

procstep.procdesc: Samples were collected in the field between 2002 and 2014. Major- and trace-element chemical analyses were performed by X-ray fluorescence by D.M. Johnson Cornelius and R.M. Conrey at Peter Hooper GeoAnalytical Laboratory of Washington State University, Pullman, Washington using methods described in Johnson et al. (1999).

R.C. Evarts compiled tables of sample locations and assigned map unit names to samples based on their chemical composition, field observations, and other properties. The location and map unit assignments were joined to the tables of unnormalized geochemical data from the Peter Hooper GeoAnalytical Laboratory to include data from Evarts et al. (2013) and Evarts and Fleck (2017).

enttyp.enttypd: Comma-separated value file containing geochemical data from XRF analyses and location of whole-rock samples from this study.

attr.attrdef: Short plain-text identifier of the map unit.

attr.attrdef: Sample number given at time of collection. Samples collected by R.C. Evarts have the following format: YY(quadrangle code)(serial locality number), where YY is the last two digits of the four-digit calendar year, and quadrangle code is as follows: BV-G = Bridal Veil 15-minute quadrangle, BD-R = Bonneville Dam 15-minute quadrangle, CM-T = Camas 15-minute quadrangle. Samples collected by R.M. Conrey have the following format: RCYY-(serial locality number); samples collected by M.H. Beeson have the following format: CG-(serial locality number).

attrdomv.udom: Free text identifier to track sample.

attr.attrdef: Lab number; 'R' at end indicates re-analysis; "null" where analysis is original

attrdomv.udom: Free text identifier to track sample.

attr.attrdef: Concentration of silicon, expressed as weight percent SiO2
Concentration of titanium, expressed as weight percent TiO2
Concentration of aluminum, expressed as weight percent Al2O3
Concentration of iron (total), expressed as weight percent FeO
Concentration of magnesium, expressed as weight percent MgO
Concentration of calcium, expressed as weight percent CaO
Concentration of sodium, expressed as weight percent Na2O
Concentration of potassium, expressed as weight percent K2O
Concentration of phosphorus, expressed as weight percent P2O5
Concentration of manganese, expressed as weight percent MnO
Concentration of lanthanum, in parts per million; blanks indicate not determined
Concentration of cerium, in parts per million; blanks indicate not determined
Concentration of neodymium, in parts per million; blanks indicate not determined
Concentration of scandium, in parts per million
Concentration of vanadium, in parts per million
Concentration of chromium, in parts per million
Concentration of nickel, in parts per million
Concentration of copper, in parts per million
Concentration of zinc, in parts per million
Concentration of gallium, in parts per million; blanks indicate not determined
Concentration of zirconium, in parts per million
Concentration of barium, in parts per million
Concentration of cesium, in parts per million; blanks indicate not determined
Concentration of niobium, in parts per million
Concentration of lead, in parts per million; blanks indicate not determined
Concentration of rubidium, in parts per million
Concentration of strontium, in parts per million
Concentration of thorium, in parts per million; blanks indicate not determined
Concentration of uranium, in parts per million; negative values indicate determinations less than the detection limit of the analytical method; blanks indicate not determined
Concentration of yttrium, in parts per million
Estimated half-width in meters of positional uncertainty envelope; position is relative to other features in database.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real number. Value of -9 indicates value is unknown.

Latitude, in decimal degrees; World Geodetic System 1984 datum.

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. Any use of trade, firm, or product names is for descriptive purposes only and does not imply endorsement by the U.S. Government.
